result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shamar S Hollins

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shamar S Hollins appeared by video.  Attorney Dean Douglas Sopcic appeared by video for Shamar S Hollins.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case in court for pretrial conference. State is in compliance with victim notification.
Defense counsel has received discovery and offer and requests additional time to review.  
Case adjourned to Branch 15.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. 
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 9/25/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Court ordered no contact with TB. 
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Shamar S Hollins in court. Attorney Madaline Witte in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date. The case is adjourned to Br. 15 for a Pretrial Conference.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Shamar S Hollins
Current: 2129 N 47th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53208 United States  (Effective: 09-23-2022)
Prior: 4556 North 71st Street, Milwaukee, WI 53218
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 9/23/22 @ 2:30p
